📱 A man & woman  aged 23 and 25 respectively  allegedly scammed S$360 000 via iPhone 13 & 14 listings on Carousell.➡️https://bit.ly/3sttJ8jFollow us on@mothershipsgfor the latest updates
This is the “daily pay jobs” the scammer have been posting in here
Oh the one that they tell people go like the listing or what ah? - E
The one you said bye bye to
is the subject mainly about the driver speeding  or the make of the car ma’am? 🤓🤓
hahahaha the driver la - E
Then got BMW mentioned thrice in the message and the article so many times
With other articles on new outlets and sgrv as well
If it's a BMW/Mercedes or some other Conti brand  they tend to mention the brand enough times that it gets drilled in the readers head
While a similar article for a Japanese or more common car would only say driver of the car
It creates / promotes some… biaseness unintentionally sometimes…
You can say.. subject car was a BMW though
And then refer to driver as driver
What if the incident involves multiple drivers? Should we name them Driver 1  Driver 2  etc? Wouldn't that just be confusing? - E
Ultimately  the biasness comes from yourself. It is not our intention to create any unhappiness for owners of any specific car brands 🤗 - E
In that case sure  use identifying factors
But in this case there's a traffic light  a driver and a rider
And we did address this issue in the entry as well.
What the fudge to that guy
Sauce also come out… I’m really struggling to keep up guys

Exactly my point - which is why i chose to single out this comment to address the branding issue ~ We are not biased towards or against any car brands. Fair for all - we only tekan the drivers hehe - E
Thus why “Driver 1 in the BM  Driver 2 in the Merc  Rider 1 on the Yamaha” should be used at the start the rest of the article is calls them by Driver 1 and 2. Pretty much like all court document.
I think they should revamp the punishment for traffic related offences
If they can up the summon for illegal exhaust
Why not for the rest of the offences
If it was really not biased towards or against any car brands. The drivers should be what they are called. Without the brands
Few years in jail for taking away innocent life is like a slap on the wrist. - E
All those small small offences only
They haven’t change the big ones
I support and thank you for that!

Our point being that the intention might not be to create a bias however it ends up creating one anyway as can be seen in the comment. And for cases where driver at fault is easily identifiable  the make of the car might just be creating a stereotype hurting other drivers around
Which was an expected and true enough.. such an outcome!
This kind of thing only like what
At worst is few months jail
What do you all think about banning from driving for life as a punishment for certain offences

Hi all. I m driving a white colour Suzuki Swift. I was at BLK 210 Hougang Street 21 carpark (behind Kovan Hawker Centre) today (26/10) afternoon. At approximately 12.15pm ~ 12.20pm  I on my hazard light  stationed my car and let my colleague alight. There was no car at the surrounding. After one of my colleague alighted  a Volkswagen white colour Van GBL8321J came from behind and collided into my bumper. The van driver then shifted the van forward in front of my car. Initially he agreed to pay for the repair / report insurance. But now he turns against his own words that he is not paying and not reporting insurance.Trying my luck here and sincerely appreciate if any one has video footage of this incident and share with me.
